question.questionText: Pam and her family were planning a hike. Pam found 2 maps of the same area. Her friend recommended she use the topographic map when they went to the lake. Which letter (Q, R, or S) on the map is on the steepest part of the trail? (Q) How do you know it is the steepest part of the trail?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: The contour lines are closest together at Q.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: As the contour lines get closer the mountain side gets steeper.
The lines are close together.
You can tell because it is at the top and it is 5000.
Because the contour lines are closer than the others.
I can tell because the contour lines closer.
S because it is closer together.
It is steeper because it is below sea level.
Because it looks like it is going further down than the others.
How do I know it is the steepest because the lines are closer.
I know because Q is at the bottom of the map.
Because the line is closer.
Because it has a line in it and probably it is a valley or something.
Because the contour lines are close to each other.
Because you can see that her lines has the top and it is steeper.
Because it is in the middle and it is steeper.
Q is the steepest part of the map the line is close together.
Because Q is moving like a snake and it is hard to go swirl like this.
Q. Because the contour lines are closer together to make it steeper.
Because it curves going up the mountain.
Because the contour lines are closer together than the other R and S.
Because the elevation increases and does not decrease.
I know because the contour lines are closer together.
